text:
I ask people to be patient as we work through a record number of new claims—more than 100,000 in just the last week.  

We are working to ensure every Virginian gets the benefits they have earned.

For information on how to file a claim, visit https://t.co/DbYHmyMbDh.

We know that many Virginians have experienced delays in filing for unemployment benefits.

Over the weekend, we upgraded the @vaemploy website, expanded server capacity, and increased call center staffing by 20 percent to process claims faster.
I'm sharing the latest updates on our continued response to #COVID19 in Virginia. Tune in here: https://t.co/Ixytf0VcKs

As National Public Health Week begins, I want to recognize @VDHgov, our local health districts, and all of Virginia's public health workers. #COVID19 has once again shown us how vital their work is, not just during this pandemic, but year round. Now more than ever, we thank them. https://t.co/lgaKTBrnz4
We are still in the early stages of this outbreak, but we must ensure that Virginia is ready when the surge of acute cases hits our healthcare system.

1️⃣ Dulles Expo Center in Northern Virginia, which can accommodate 315 acute or 510 non-acute beds

2️⃣ Hampton Roads Convention Center, providing 360 acute or 580 non-acute beds

3️⃣ Richmond Convention Center, which could bring 432 acute or 758 non-acute beds online

We have been working with @USACEHQ to identify and evaluate alternative care sites, which will free up bed capacity in our existing hospital system. 

Yesterday, I approved their final recommendations and construction will begin soon at these three facilities:

I've been in the medical field for over 30 years, and I've rarely seen a pathogen as contagious as #COVID19.

People must take this seriously—period. https://t.co/xgYJgcC4Xh

Unfortunately, Virginia's fiscal year does not align with the federal fiscal year. The state's year ends June 30, while the federal ends in October. If we moved tax deadlines past that date, it would create a massive hole in our current budget, requiring large cuts to services. https://t.co/ywJq8u807e

The federal Families First Coronavirus Act makes paid family medical leave options available to many businesses. Learn more here: https://t.co/4hI8akoW4Q. And if you have to stay home to care for a family member, you should apply for unemployment benefits through @vaemploy. https://t.co/fdQtkFoCXg

Let me be clear—we need med school students in this fight. The best way you can help is to volunteer with the Virginia Medical Reserve Corps, where you will be matched with an assignment based on need and your skill set. Sign up at https://t.co/T1yakxkb6f. https://t.co/5HACKIjy8H

The lack of testing supplies is a tremendous problem in public and private labs nationwide, which is a big reason for this backlog. Thankfully we just doubled our ability to process tests in our state lab, which does not have a backlog and can now give results in 12-24 hours. https://t.co/LQPSBXzGf2

Great question, Ebony. #COVID19 is a new disease and we have limited information about risk factors. We do know that people with underlying medical conditions could be at higher risk for severe illness from the virus. That's why staying home and practicing good hygiene is key. https://t.co/ie6EGiiw9H

Yes, @VDOE_News has announced a variety of waivers for different teacher licenses. You can find more information online here: https://t.co/fpaI65wgtR. Thanks for all you are doing for Virginia's students during these challenging times. https://t.co/lEtsupDfcv

Remind your loved ones that this is a serious crisis, and there are serious consequences for ignoring the measures we've put in place. Not only can you be charged with a misdemeanor for violating the ban on 10-person gatherings, but you're putting yourself and others at risk. https://t.co/ivIrEBbFp6

No Virginia family should go without the services they need due to #COVID19. Last week @VDSS issued emergency SNAP benefits to 225,000 households and will do so again on April 16. Families receiving TANF can apply for a one-time emergency benefit of $500 to help meet their needs. https://t.co/QlNpK2EezC

My administration is working with the General Assembly on a plan for how they can safely conduct the scheduled reconvened session on April 22. In the meantime, I have been reviewing and signing bills to ensure we meet the April 11 deadline for action on legislation. https://t.co/YWgTyxiWcX

Our Commonwealth is large and geographically diverse, which means the virus may peak at different times in different places. Strong regional cooperation is critical as we continue responding to #COVID19 in the weeks and months ahead. @MayorBowser, @GovLarryHogan, and I are working closely together to mitigate the spread of the virus in the National Capital Region.

Read our joint statement: https://t.co/dCtPOIIan2

I am also ordering all schools in Virginia to remain closed at least through the end of this academic year.

I know these changes will raise many questions and create new challenges—but I am also confident in our ability to be resilient and navigate these waters together.

Today, I am ordering certain non-essential businesses to close for 30 days, banning gatherings of more than 10 people, and requiring restaurants to do carryout or delivery only. This starts Tuesday, March 24 at 11:59 PM.

As we continue responding to the #COVID19 outbreak, my highest priority is protecting the health and safety of all Virginians. This is an unprecedented situation, and it requires unprecedented action.

Here’s what that means for Virginians⬇️
Governor Northam COVID-19 Briefing – March 23 https://t.co/u8kXFDq03u

3️⃣ @VDOE_News is preparing Virginia's application for a waiver from federal testing requirements.

And my administration is evaluating the steps we can take to provide relief to students on state mandated SOL tests, which go beyond those mandated by the federal government.

2️⃣ We have revised our testing criteria to give additional priority to first responders and medical professionals who have had contact with #COVID19 patients and people in nursing homes and long-term care facilities.

At my #COVID19 briefing this morning, I shared the following key updates:

1️⃣ Last night, I signed an executive order that gives our hospitals and nursing homes more flexibility to add the beds they need without going through red tape. Learn more here: https://t.co/8NRWjb4p6w https://t.co/LP9acBMFKJ

WATCH LIVE: I'm holding a #COVID19 briefing with the Virginia Emergency Support Team.

https://t.co/SNdePsaKTG or on @NBC12: https://t.co/3O6pkzADKZ
And I am heartened by all the businesses that are working hard to modify their operations to follow health and safety guidelines, while they continue to serve customers’ needs.
I also want to thank all the workers in places like our grocery stores and pharmacies who are stocking our shelves as fast as they can—we are grateful for them.

I want to thank all the people on the front lines of this public health emergency—from the doctors and nurses, to the public health professionals, first responders, and even the scientists who are racing to develop new tests and a vaccine for #COVID19.

We are all experiencing big, unwanted changes that can cause stress and anxiety.

If you or someone you know is feeling depressed or suicidal, call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline, @800273TALK (1-800-273-8255) or the @samhsagov Disaster Distress Helpline, 1-800-985-5990.
For a complete list of #COVID19 resources in Virginia, please visit https://t.co/XNjzM5VF5W.

➡️ Finally, today I announced that @VirginiaABC will allow restaurants to sell beer and wine for takeout and delivery. This will help restaurants across Virginia whose operations have been affected by the #COVID19 outbreak.

➡️ I also reminded Virginians that while we are all focused on #COVID19, the 2020 Census is now underway—and it’s critical that we still fill out our census forms so Virginia has a complete and accurate count of its residents.

For more information go to https://t.co/B4bQek5vnr.

➡️ We are doing everything we can to help people impacted by this public health crisis—Virginians who have been temporarily laid off or discharged from their jobs can file a claim with @vaemploy by calling 1-866-832-2363 or by visiting https://t.co/o9lbI5xQPG.

As we continue to respond to this public health crisis, my top priority will always be keeping Virginians safe and healthy, and ensuring that we leave no one behind.

The full list of resources we've mobilized to address #COVID19 is available at https://t.co/XNjzM5VF5W.

And I've directed @VSPPIO to suspend the enforcement of motor vehicle safety inspections for 60 days.

For additional information about any of the measures I announced today, visit
https://t.co/IipYbxL5YK

I'm encouraging local criminal justice officials to explore proactive measures to combat the spread of #COVID19 at our state correctional facilities while maintaining public safety.

@VADOC has also suspended in-person visitation and all transfers from local and regional jails.

I've asked @VaTax to extend the due date for individual and corporate income taxes in Virginia to June 1 (filing deadlines remain the same).

Businesses affected by #COVID19 can also request to defer payment of state sales tax—due tomorrow—for 30 days.

We received approval from @SBAgov today allowing small businesses and nonprofits impacted by the #COVID19 outbreak to apply for low-interest federal disaster loans of up to $2 million.

Submit an application here💻: https://t.co/898dXk7UFv

Together with @VDSS, we're adapting child care operations to increase flexibility for families and providers.

We're supporting the 1.5 million Virginians enrolled in Medicaid by:
▫️ Eliminating all co-payments
▫️ Allowing a 90-day supply of routine prescriptions
▫️ Waiving pre-approval requirements
▫️ Expanding access to telehealth services

The @VAStateCorpComm is directing the utilities it regulates—electric, natural gas, and water companies—to suspend service disconnections for 60 days. This action will provide immediate relief to customers, residential and business, who have been financially affected by #COVID19.

I have ordered the @VirginiaDMV to temporarily close to the public. You can still renew a driver's license or vehicle registration online, and we will grant a 60-day extension those who cannot renew online, or whose license or registration expires before May 15.

We are also helping working Virginians impacted by the #COVID19 outbreak by:
➡️waiving the waiting period for unemployment benefits
➡️enhancing eligibility for unemployment
➡️loosening restrictions for those receiving unemployment insurance

We know this will affected many workers and businesses, and we are taking steps to support those who are impacted by these decisions.

Learn more here: https://t.co/lZxc446YMX

Virginians with chronic health conditions and those 65 and older are at increased risk of severe illness from #COVID19 and should self-quarantine. We must all do our part to regularly check in with high-risk individuals who are staying at home.

I am ordering all restaurants, fitness centers, and theaters to significantly reduce their capacity to 10 patrons, or close. We encourage restaurants to continue offering carry-out and takeaway options.

I am urging Virginians to further reduce the size of public gatherings to 10 people or less, per federal guidelines.  Essential services like manufacturers, distribution centers, airports, bus and train stations, medical facilities, grocery stores, and pharmacies aren't included.

.@VirginiaDHRM has directed all state agencies to update their emergency operations and paid leave policies.

Virginia is setting an example by activating public health emergency leave for state employees who have recently traveled to high-risk areas.

We're committed to addressing possible barriers to care:

✅ We're working with Virginia insurers to waive costs associated with #COVID19 diagnostic testing.

Together with @VaMedicaidDir, @VDSS, and local partners, we're working to ensure no Virginian goes hungry in the event of extended school closures or isolation due to #COVID19, and our most vulnerable populations have continued access to critical services.

We've directed all school districts to update their pandemic plans in consultation with their local health departments.

And we will continue working in close coordination with college and university presidents to provide guidance and address their individual situations.

✅ We’ve expanded our criteria for diagnostic testing to ensure that anyone who has symptoms and is in a nursing home is a top priority.

✅ We’ve also provided guidance to nursing homes and senior care facilities on additional visitor screening.

In Virginia, we've taken steps to prepare for and protect Virginians from #COVID19—and we will continue to execute our plans across all levels of government.

I’m outlining my agenda to advance to historic justice and equity in our Commonwealth—these proposals will help us tell the full and accurate story of Virginia’s past. Watch here: https://t.co/SNdePsaKTG

We’ve got a lot to do for the people of Virginia. And when we do it right, treating each other with respect and decency, our Commonwealth will once again show the country how to lead. Let’s make Virginia proud. #SOTC https://t.co/KZV5Pse5m8

Tonight, I’ve presented an agenda that is different from every previous General Assembly session. It’s a lot bolder, and it’s more forward-looking than ever before. I’m here as your Governor because I’m a builder, and I hope you will choose to build too. #SOTC

We all represent everyone who lives in this great Commonwealth. Whether we know them, or whether we like them. It calls us to reach out of ourselves, to be larger, to be generous of heart. To be forgiving, and to treat each other as we would like to be treated. #SOTC

Virginians spoke in November, and they expect votes and laws to make Virginia safer. Let’s have an honest conversation based on fact, not fear—these laws are intended to keep Virginians safe. Period. It’s time to act. #SOTC

Gun violence takes the lives of more than 1,000 Virginians every year—three people every day. Virginians have had enough of the vigils and the funerals, enough of the mourning. They made that clear at the ballot box. #EnoughIsEnough #SOTC

This means decriminalizing marijuana possession—and clearing the records of people who’ve gotten in trouble for it. It means making permanent the temporary policy passed last year—the one that says no more suspended driver's licenses, just because you owe court fines. #SOTC
We need to take an honest look at our criminal justice system, to make sure we’re treating people fairly—and using taxpayer dollars wisely. And it’s time to temper justice with mercy. #SOTC
We need to let localities decide what to do with the Confederate monuments in their community. They know the right thing to do. #SOTC
In recent years, Virginia has steadily added more restrictions on voting. This infringes on our most basic civil right as Americans. We need to make it easier to vote, not harder. #SOTC

It’s time to remove the overtly discriminatory language from Virginia's books. Then, we will pass comprehensive protections in employment, housing, and public accommodations for LGBTQ people. These are important steps toward building a more equal, just, and inclusive state. #SOTC

Basic fairness and equity are the foundation of our legislative agenda for this session. If we are going to move forward, we must take an honest look at our past. We know that racial discrimination is rooted in many of the laws that have governed our Commonwealth. #SOTC

If you believe in clean energy, if you want to see American manufacturing jobs right here in Virginia, jobs that will supply parts for offshore wind up and down the East Coast, then I ask you to pass this budget. #SOTC

We're leading by example. Last fall, we signed the country’s largest contract to buy renewable energy to power state government. We’re finally joining the Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative. We’re replacing old diesel school buses with new electric ones. #SOTC

I’ve seen how fragile our natural resources can be. I’ve seen over and over again how a clean environment and a strong economy go hand-in-hand. So we made this a priority from the beginning, and we have accomplished a lot, starting with combatting climate change. #SOTC

It’s time to end the laws that restrict a woman’s right to direct her own health care. They’re not about health care—they're about injecting politics and the government into the relationship between a woman and her physician. #SOTC

Do you want more behavioral health care and community services? Do you want military service members and veterans to have better access to health care? This budget does that too. This is the right thing to do as we shape a Virginia that represents everyone. #SOTC

I ask you to pass the healthcare equity budget I sent you last month—Do you want to see new mothers get more home visits? Should new mothers get access to health care for a year after their baby is born? This budget does that. #SOTC

Her physical health improved. Her mental health improved. The fear is gone. She’s working. She’s learning new things, and she’s giving back. Her life has literally been transformed. She said, "I don’t have to just exist in this world anymore. Now, I have a chance to live.” #SOTC

Then, three years ago, she got a place to live. A group called @vshousing helped her find it. They demonstrate that the best way to make sure people have a roof over their head is to put a roof over their head. #SOTC

It changes everything when you have a safe place to come home to every night. I saw that recently, when I met Karen Harris in Richmond. She had been without a place to live for more than 20 years. She told me, “It feels like there’s no hope. That no one cares.” #SOTC

We’re also increasing funding for Virginia’s two public historically black colleges and universities. They play a critical role in training our workforce, and these funds will help bring them more in line with other universities. #SOTC

We are increasing funding to make public colleges more affordable. We are increasing the Tuition Assistance Grants that make private colleges more affordable. We’re making it easier for DREAMers to attend college and get ahead, with in-state tuition. #SOTC

I’m sending you a proposal to help people “Get Skilled, Get a Job, and Give Back.” We call it “G3.” If you need help, and if you choose to go into a high-demand field, and if you commit to community service, then Virginia will cover your tuition, fees, and books. #SOTC

We need to invest in our K-12 public schools—with teacher raises, more guidance counselors, and extra funds for high-need schools. An investment in public schools is an investment in students and our economy. #SOTC

I’m grateful to @FirstLadyVA for bringing together the early childhood community—parents, providers, the business community and more. They all know that if we invest in little learners today, we’ll see great results for adults tomorrow. It’s time for Virginia to get moving. #SOTC

Broadband has become an economic necessity for business, for education, for healthcare, and for everyday life. I’ve sent you a budget that invests $35 million each year to get more communities connected—I ask you to pass it. #SOTC

But just because you have a job doesn’t always mean you can survive on it. The people who are building our economy should benefit from it too. The companies that recognize this will get ahead. So let’s work together to raise the minimum wage. #SOTC

Our economic climate has brought Virginia one of the country’s lowest unemployment rates, at 2.6%. It’s rarely been this low in the technology era, and every region of Virginia is experiencing a lower unemployment rate than a year ago. #SOTC
We serve the people, and they have been clear: They expect us to face Virginia’s modern challenges and to lead the way forward, to make our shared home an even better place to live and work. #SOTC

It’s a proud moment to look out and see a General Assembly that reflects, more than ever, the Virginia we see every day. This is truly an historic night—follow along as I give an update on the state of our Commonwealth and share my plans for building a stronger Virginia. #SOTC

I’m proud of everything we’ve done to move Virginia forward over the past year, but there’s still important work ahead. Tonight at 7:00 PM, I’ll share my plans to build on our progress in my annual State of the Commonwealth address. #SOTC
